STATE OF MICHIGAN
DEPARTMENT OF HEALTH AND HUMAN SERVICES
GRETCHEN WHITMER ROBERT GORDON
LANSING
GOVERNOR DIRECTOR
October 29, 2020
Kathleen Schultz
Wellspring Lutheran Services -E. Lansing
3681 Okemos Road #500
Okemos, MI 48864
RE: License #: CB330371021
Wellspring Lutheran Services -E. Lansing
3681 Okemos Road #500
Okemos, MI 48864
Dear Ms. Schultz:
Attached is the Interim Report for the above referenced facility completed on 10/21/20.
Due to the violations of applicable licensing rules, sections of the contract and
Implementation, Sustainability, and Exit Plan (ISEP) requirements, a written corrective
action plan is required. It should be noted that violations of any licensing rules are also
violations of the ISEP and your contract. The corrective action plan is due 15 days from
the date of this letter and must include the following:
 How compliance with each citation will be achieved.
 Who is directly responsible for implementing the corrective action for each
licensing statute and rule or section of the contract or ISEP citation.
 Specific time frames for each citation as to when the correction will be
completed or implemented.
 For any repeat violations, include an assessment of why the previous
corrective action plan was ineffective.
 How continuing compliance will be maintained once compliance is
achieved.
 The signature of the responsible party and a date.
If you fail to submit an acceptable corrective action plan, disciplinary action may result.
Please review the enclosed documentation for accuracy and contact me with any
questions. In the event that I am not available and you need to speak to someone
immediately, please contact the area manager at (616) 552-3662.
P.O. BOX 30650  LANSING, MICHIGAN 48909
www.michigan.gov  (517) 335-1980

Sincerely,
Rorie Dodge-Garnaat, Licensing Consultant
MDHHS\Division of Child Welfare Licensing
235 Grand, Ste 1305
P.O. Box 30650
Lansing, MI 48909
(517) 899-6024
enclosure
2

DIVISION OF CHILD WELFARE LICENSING

III. DESCRIPTION OF FINDINGS
1.) The facility is in compliance with all applicable licensing statutes and rules
except for the following:
R 400.12327 Special evaluation.
(1) An agency shall do all of the following when anyone in the
agency receives information that relates to possible
noncompliance with any foster home rule:
(c) Conduct a thorough investigation including all necessary
collateral contacts.
3 of 3 special evaluations reviewed did not indicate a thorough investigation was
completed.
R 400.12327 Special evaluation.
(1) An agency shall do all of the following when anyone in the
agency receives information that relates to possible
noncompliance with any foster home rule:
(d) Dates and places of contacts, names of persons
interviewed, and names of the interviewers. If children are
interviewed, their last names shall not be included in the report.
1 of 3 special evaluations reviewed listed the foster child’s first and last name.
R 400.12413 Medical and dental care policy.
(1) An agency's medical and dental care policy shall, at a
minimum, include all of the following:
(d) Current immunizations for each child as required by
section 5111 of 1978 PA 368, MCL 333.5111. All of the
following apply:
(i) A statement from a parent or licensed medical authority
which indicates that immunizations are current or
contraindicated is sufficient documentation of immunizations.
(ii) A copy of a waiver addressed to the department of
community health signed by the parent stating immunizations
are not being administered due to religious, medical, or other
reasons is sufficient documentation of immunizations.
(iii) If documentation of immunization or a copy of the
waiver is unavailable, then immunizations shall begin within 30
calendar days of placement.
4

1 of 6 foster care cases reviewed did not have updated immunizations.
This is a repeat violation cited during the 2019 Renewal with a CAP accepted
on 10/2/19.
R 400.12418 Development of service plans.
(2) An agency shall complete written service plans for each child
and parent or parents, as follows:
(b) Within 120 calendar days after the initial removal and at
least once every 90 calendar days thereafter.
1 of 19 Foster Care Updated Service Plans reviewed was incomplete.
R 400.12509 Independent living record.
(3) The case record shall contain all of the following information
and documentation, which shall be recorded within 30 calendar
days after placement in independent living and updated at least
once every 90 calendar days:
(g) Current documentation of financial support sufficient to
meet the youth's housing, clothing, food, and miscellaneous
expenses.
1 of 2 Independent Living files reviewed did not have a budget completed.
R 400.12510 Independent living contract.
(1) There shall be a mutually agreed upon contract between
the youth and the agency specifying all of the following:
(a) The responsibilities of the agency and the youth.
(b) A plan for education or work.
(c) An agreement for the youth to meet with the worker at
least one time per calendar month.
(d) The location where the youth is living.
1 of 2 Independent Living files reviewed did not have any contracts.
This is a repeat violation cited during the 2019 Renewal with a CAP accepted
on 10/2/19.
2.) Any violation listed in section 1 is also an ISEP violation. Please note that there
are additional ISEP requirements that may not be included in section 1. The
facility is in compliance will all additional ISEP requirements.
3.) Any violation listed in section 1 is also a DHS Contract violation. Please note that
there are additional DHS Contract/Policy requirements that may not be included
5

in section 1. The facility is in compliance will all additional DHS Contract/Policy
requirements except for the following:
FOM 801 Medical Passports
An updated medical passport is provided to:
• The child’s foster care provider:
At or prior to each placement.
Quarterly.
4 of 6 Foster care case files reviewed did not have quarterly medical passports
signed by the placement indicating they received the passport.
FOM 722-09 Supervisory Approval - USP
Case service plan approval process requires the foster care
supervisor to:
• Review and approve the USP within 14 calendar days of the
report date.
4 of 19 Updated Service Plans were approved late:
 1 was approved 8 days late
 1 was approved 11 days late
 1 was approved 14 days late, and
 1 was approved 17 days late
This is a repeat violation cited during the 2019 Renewal with a CAP accepted
on 10/2/19.
FOM 722-08C Required Participation in Development - Foster Parent /
Caregiver
The foster parent/caregiver signature is required and indicates
that the foster parent/caregiver acknowledges and agrees to the
activities required to meet the needs of the child in their care.
2 of 21 Service Plans reviewed did not have a caregiver signature.
This is a repeat violation cited during the 2019 Renewal with a CAP accepted
on 10/2/19.
FOM 722-08C Required Participation in Development - Parents and Youth
over 14-Years Old
Parents and youths age 14 and older must sign the PATP.
6

7 of 21 Service Plans reviewed did not have parents’ signatures.
FOM 722-06H TIMELY ENTRY OF CASEWORKER CONTACTS
All face-to-face contacts must be entered in MiSACWIS, within
five business days of the contact.
4 of 6 Foster Care files reviewed did not have timely entry of face to face contacts
into MiSACWIS.
FOM 722-06B FTM PRACTICE GUIDANCE Documentation
The DHHS-1105, FTM Report, must be completed for every
FTM. These documents must also be uploaded into MISACWIS.
2 of 6 Foster Care cases reviewed did not have all 1105 forms uploaded into
MiSACWIS.
This is a repeat violation cited during the 2019 Renewal with a CAP accepted
on 10/2/19.
FOM 722-08E FOSTER CARE ACTION SUMMARY REQUIREMENTS
The Foster Care/Juvenile Justice (FC/JJ) Action Summary,
DHHS-69 (RFF 69), is used whenever there is “action” on a
case.
The caseworker must complete the DHS-69, Foster
Care/Juvenile Justice Action Summary and upload to
MiSACWIS within the timeframe required for the specified
action/change.
Prior to a planned placement change, or within three business
days of an emergency placement change…
1 of 4 closed Foster Care files reviewed did not have a completed Action Summary
for case closure.
1 of 2 Independent Living files reviewed did not have an Action Summary completed
for a change of placement.
2 of 6 Foster Care files reviewed did not have timely completion of the Action
Summary.
This is a repeat violation cited during the 2019 Renewal with a CAP accepted
on 10/2/19.
7

IV. TECHNICAL ASSISTANCE
The facility was offered technical assistance in the following areas:
 All employee references need to be dated for verification they were obtained
prior to hire.
 Document in social work contacts attempts that were made to go over the
PATP and obtain signatures.
V. CONSULTATION
The facility was offered consultation in the following areas:
 Ensure all documents are uploaded to the correct case file and in the correct
location.
VI. EVALUATION OF RENEWAL PERIOD
There were not any incidents of substantiated child abuse and/or neglect during this
licensing period.
There was one incident of substantiated corporal punishment during this licensing
period. A youth reported that he had been spanked by his foster mother. The Foster
Home was found in violation of R 400.9404 Behavior Management and a Corrective
Action Plan was required. The agency did not conduct a thorough investigation as
they did not follow up on the youth’s statement that this was not a one-time
occurrence. The agency is being cited for not conducting a thorough investigation.
That citation is listed above.
The agency has not been required to submit and corrective action plans during this
licensing period.
The agency does have several repeat violations that need to be addressed. It should
be noted that the agency reported the COVID-19 pandemic made it difficult for staff
to upload documents and obtaining signed documents from foster parents, relatives,
and bio-parents.
VII. ANALYST FINDINGS
The Field Analyst visited three foster homes and three relative homes. During those
home visits there were no safety concerns noted. Any service concerns were
addressed with the managers during the entrance conference.
8

VIII. RECOMMENDATION
Based on inspection findings the agency is not in compliance with all applicable
licensing statutes and rules, ISEP, and/or contract requirements. Upon receipt of an
acceptable corrective action plan, it is recommended that the facility continue on a
regular license.
10/27/2020
________________________________________
Rorie Dodge-Garnaat Date
Licensing Consultant
Approved By:
October 29, 2020
________________________________________
Claudia Triestram Date
Area Manager
9
